document_title: Rectal polyps: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: polyp-truc-trang.json_1_Who is at risk for rectal polyps?
subsection_content:
Several factors may increase the risk of developing colon polyps. If you or a loved one has one or more of the following factors, you need to pay more attention:
People over 50 years old; People who are overweight or obese; Have a family history of polyps or colorectal cancer (1); Have had polyps in the past; Women with ovarian or uterine cancer before age 50; Have an inflammatory condition that affects the colon, such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis; Have diabetes; Have a genetic disorder, such as Lynch syndrome or Gardner syndrome
In addition to the above risks, there are a number of lifestyle behaviors that can contribute to the development of rectal polyps including:
Or smoke; Drink alcohol regularly; Have a sedentary lifestyle; Diet high in fat and grease; low in fiber
